title: Use uploaded image as site logo

requirements.text: Replace the current site logo with the user-uploaded image (website logo.png) by generating and using a 512x512 logo asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/flame-issue-tracker-logo.dim_512x512.png (the same path currently referenced in the header), ensuring the logo renders correctly in the header on all pages.

quotes: use this as the website logo

acceptanceCriteria: The header logo loads from /assets/generated/flame-issue-tracker-logo.dim_512x512.png without 404s.
The displayed header logo matches the uploaded image (website logo.png).
The logo displays crisply at the current header size (h-10 w-10) on both mobile and desktop views.

requirements.text: Add a favicon derived from the uploaded logo and reference it in frontend/index.html so browser tabs show the new icon.

quotes: use this as the website logo

acceptanceCriteria: A favicon file is present in frontend/public (or frontend/public/assets/generated) and is referenced via a <link rel="icon" ...> tag in frontend/index.html.
Opening the app shows the new favicon in the browser tab (after a hard refresh).

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only).
Do not edit files listed as immutable paths in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose around them instead).
nonGoals: Change complaint/solutions functionality or backend data models.

edits: Convert/crop/scale the uploaded logo into a square 512x512 asset suitable for a header logo (website logo.png > flame-issue-tracker-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Generate a small favicon from the uploaded logo (website logo.png > favicon.dim_32x32.png)
